name: Lil Tjay
description:
'''Tione Jayden Merritt''' ([[International Phonetic Alphabet|IPA]]: {{IPA|[taj.oʊn d͡ʒeɪ.dən ˈmɛɹ.ɪt]|lang=en}}) (born April 30, 2001), known professionally as '''Lil Tjay''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|t|i:|d|ʒ|eɪ|audio=LL-Q1860 (eng)-Flame, not lame-Lil Tjay.wav}} {{respell|TEE|jay}}), is an American rapper. He rose to prominence with his 2017 single "Resume", and signed with [[Columbia Records]] following the success of his 2018 single "[[Brothers (Lil Tjay song)|Brothers]]", which received [[RIAA certification|triple platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). His guest appearance on [[Polo G]]'s 2019 single, "[[Pop Out]]" marked his first entry on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]—peaking at number 11—while his own single, "[[F.N (song)|F.N]]" became his first to do so as a lead artist. Each preceded the release of his debut studio album, ''[[True 2 Myself]]'' (2019), which peaked at number five on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]].

His second studio album, ''[[Destined 2 Win]]'' (2021) was supported by the single "[[Calling My Phone]]" (with [[6lack]]), which peaked at number three on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100. His 2023 song "[[Gangsta Boo (song)|Gangsta Boo]]" (with [[Ice Spice]]) likewise entered the chart, and his third studio album, ''[[222 (album)|222]]'', was released in July of that year.
